orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants' calendar constraints and produce a PDDL domain and problem targeting the FastDownwards solver that schedules a one-hour meeting on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 respecting all constraints.

public_information: Schedule a one-hour meeting for Michelle, Steven, and Jerry on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00.
Work hours on Monday are from 09:00 to 17:00.
Time granularity to consider is 30 minutes.
There exists at least one time slot that works for all participants given their current schedules.

availability.system_prompt: You are an expert at personal calendar analysis and scheduling. You know your own busy times and constraints and you communicate your availability windows clearly.
availability.prompt: Your name is michelle. You have the following private calendar constraints: {agents->michelle->private_information}. The public scheduling requirements are: {environment->public_information}. Provide a concise list of your available time windows on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that could accommodate a one-hour meeting, formatted as plain text with each availability interval on its own line (for example: '09:30-11:00'). Do not emit PDDL.

availability.system_prompt: You are an expert at personal calendar analysis and scheduling. You know your own busy times and constraints and you communicate your availability windows clearly.
availability.prompt: Your name is steven. You have the following private calendar constraints: {agents->steven->private_information}. The public scheduling requirements are: {environment->public_information}. Provide a concise list of your available time windows on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that could accommodate a one-hour meeting, formatted as plain text with each availability interval on its own line. Do not emit PDDL.

availability.system_prompt: You are an expert at personal calendar analysis and scheduling. You know your own busy times and constraints and you communicate your availability windows clearly.
availability.prompt: Your name is jerry. You have the following private calendar constraints: {agents->jerry->private_information}. The public scheduling requirements are: {environment->public_information}. Provide a concise list of your available time windows on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00 that could accommodate a one-hour meeting, formatted as plain text with each availability interval on its own line. Do not emit PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL modeling for planners such as FastDownwards. You integrate participants' availability information into a single PDDL domain and problem that encodes scheduling a one-hour meeting. You must keep agents' roles/actions distinct and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Here are the public scheduling requirements: {environment->public_information}. Here are the availability reports received: {availability_michelle} {availability_steven} {availability_jerry}. Using that information, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode scheduling a one-hour meeting for Michelle, Steven, and Jerry on Monday between 09:00 and 17:00, respecting all reported busy intervals. Use time slots consistent with the time granularity in the environment init and target the FastDownwards solver. Keep participants' actions distinct where appropriate. Think step by step and output a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
